alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Butte, Blackfoot Region; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 8:46AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of northeastern Idaho, northeastern Clearwater, Mineral, southwestern Missoula, southeastern Sanders, central Deer Lodge, central Granite, northeastern Ravalli, west central Silver Bow and southern Powell Counties through 945 AM MST/845 AM PST/... At 845 AM MST/745 AM PST/, Doppler radar was tracking a line of snow showers extending from near St. Regis to near Anaconda. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one mile or less. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Superior, Anaconda, Lolo, Stevensville, Philipsburg, Alberton, Florence, St. Regis, Tarkio, Riverbend, West Valley, Ninemile, Lozeau, Quigley, Quartz, Lolo Hot Springs, Porters Corner, Bell Crossing and Keystone. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 25 and 79. Highway 93 S between mile markers 60 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Butte, Blackfoot Region; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys
